Uses of Class
net.jhoogland.jautomata.AbstractAutomaton

  • Packages that use AbstractAutomaton 
    Package Description
    net.jhoogland.jautomata  
    net.jhoogland.jautomata.operations  

    • Uses of AbstractAutomaton in net.jhoogland.jautomata

      Subclasses of AbstractAutomaton in net.jhoogland.jautomata 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  ArrayAutomaton<L,K>
      Implementation of Automaton that is backed up by arrays of states and transitions.
      class  EditableAutomaton<L,K>
      An automaton type that can be edited using the addState and addTransition methods.
      class  ExplicitAutomaton<L,K>
      Subclasses of this abstract class implement automaton types that explicitly store information of states (initial weight, final weight, incoming/outgoing transitions) and transitions (previous/next state, label, weight).
      class  HashAutomaton<L,K>
      Implementation of Automaton that is backed up by HashMaps that contain information of states and transitions.
      class  HashTransducer<I,O,K>
      Implementation of Automaton that is backed up by HashMaps that contain information of states and transitions.
      class  SingleStringAutomaton<L,K>
      An automaton type that only accepts a single specified string.

    • Uses of AbstractAutomaton in net.jhoogland.jautomata.operations

      Subclasses of AbstractAutomaton in net.jhoogland.jautomata.operations 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AcceptorIntersection<L,K>
      Implementation of acceptor intersection.
      class  ArrayMTIntersection<L,K>
      Intersection of array-based multi-tape automata for a single intersection tape.
      class  Closure<L,K>
      Implementation of the Kleene closure.
      class  Concatenation<L,K>
      Concatenation of multiple automata.
      class  Determinization<L,K>
      This is an implementation of the on-the-fly determinization algorithm described in [1].
      class  EpsilonRemoval<L,K>
      This is an implementation of the on-the-fly epsilon removal algorithm described in [1].
      class  EpsilonRemoval.EpsilonAutomaton 
      class  HashMTIntersection<I,L,K>
      Intersection of HashMap-based multi-tape automata for a single intersection tape.
      class  Intersection<L1,L2,L3,K>
      Abstract implementation of generic automaton intersection.
      class  KTropicalSemiringConversion<K extends Comparable<K>,L>
      Conversion of the Boolean, log, and tropical semiring to the k-tropical semiring.
      class  LabelConversion<L1,L2,K>
      Abstract class for label conversion operations.
      class  MTIntersection<I,L,K>
      Abstract class for multi-tape intersection with a single intersection tape.
      class  MTLabelConversion<L1,I,L2,K>
      Abstract class for label conversion operations for multi-tape automata.
      class  Push<L,K>
      Reweights the specified automaton using the the generic shortest distance to the final states as potential function.
      class  ReversedAutomaton<L,K>
      Implementation of automaton reversal.
      class  Reweight<L,K>
      Reweights an automaton in such a way that the path weights are preserved.
      class  SemiringConversion<L,K1,K2>
      Abstract class for semiring conversion operations.
      class  SingleInitialStateOperation<L,K>
      This operation creates an automaton that is equivalent to the operand automaton, but has only one initial state.
      class  TransducerComposition<I,L,O,K>
      Transducer composition of two transducers.
      class  TransducerLabelConversion<L,I,O,K>
      Abstract class for label conversion operations for transducers.
      class  UnaryOperation<L1,L2,K1,K2>
      Abstract class for unary operations on automata.
      class  Union<L,K>
      Implementation of the union of a set of automata (its operands).
